item.title: You Live on a Boat?!
item.description: People often ask why we live on a boat. Here’s the story in a nutshell. I was laid off from Oseberg back in 2015 because the oil market collapsed. At the time, everyone in the American oil & gas industry was hurting and most companies had to make big cuts just to survive. I was pushing some big, forward-looking ideas at Oseberg and I was proud of the impact I was having on the business but, unfortunately for me, big, forward-looking ideas are a luxury you can’t afford when the business is bleeding money.

item.title: Travel
item.description: My fiancé and I live on Stay Foolish, our Island Packet sailboat, with our two dogs. We love to travel, explore, and meet new people. Living on a boat allows us to do all of those things while having the comforts of home wherever we go. It’s pretty great. You can follow our adventures aboard Stay Foolish by liking our Facebook page.

item.title: About Me
item.description: I’m an experienced software engineer and product developer. I enjoy traveling, sailing, scuba diving, great food, wine, and snark. I’m passionate about philosophy, politics, usability, and self-determination. I called New Orleans home for nearly 10 years but now travel on Stay Foolish. I’ve lived an unconventional life which has given me an unconventional perspective. I wouldn’t have it any other way.

item.title: The Cobbler's Children
item.description: The trope of the Cobbler’s children having no shoes seems appropriate here. I’ve been a professional software developer for 12 years and I’ve never had a personal website… until now. It is also interesting how little personal code I have on GitHub and other repositories. The sad truth is that most of the software I’ve built since Joomla has been entirely proprietary. And, even worse, many of the apps and sites I’ve worked on, no longer exist.
